title: Faul leaves the putana
content:
[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/4989240.stm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102131714/http:/news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/4989240.stm "http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/4989240.stm")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102131714im_/http:/typophile.com/files/paul_billy_shepherd_differences_5047.gif)

[http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/tonyparsons/tm\_column\_date=26072004-name\_in...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102131714/http:/www.mirror.co.uk/news/tonyparsons/tm_column_date=26072004-name_index.html "http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/tonyparsons/tm\_column\_date=26072004-name\_index.html")  
SHE'S NOBODY'S 'POOL

TALKING about the misery of Iraq on Sky News's Adam Boulton show, Heather Mills McCartney was her usual self.

Passionate. Committed. Hard as nails. Fake as a nine-bob note.

How long has Heather had a Liverpool accent? Was it a wedding present?

Does she have a pre-nuptial agreement with Sir Paul that means she gets custody of the accent in the event of a divorce?

Maybe this bolt-on accent is sub-conscious, a way of deepening her bond with hubby.

I do not know.

But Heather Mills McCartney is the only person I've ever seen who makes Jimmy Tarbuck look like a soft Southern cissy.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102131714im_/http:/typophile.com/files/heathernude_6347.jpg)

[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/in\_depth/uk/2000/newsmakers/2031333.stm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102131714/http:/news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/in_depth/uk/2000/newsmakers/2031333.stm "http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/in\_depth/uk/2000/newsmakers/2031333.stm")
author: vinceconnare
